definition[0]: used to begin a list of two or more possibilities
example[0]: You add either one or two cloves of garlic.
example[1]: She’s the kind of person you either love or hate.
definition[1]: used to say that if one thing does not happen then something else will have to
example[2]: It’s your choice! Either she leaves or I will!
example[3]: £75 seems a lot to pay for a starter motor, but it’s either that or a new car!
definition[2]: a situation in which you cannot avoid having to make a decision or choice
